title: Skullcandy’s New Gaming Headphones Feature Spatial Audio and Multi-Platform Support
description: You're also getting up to 48 hours of battery life, which should be ideal for lengthy online matches. The post Skullcandy’s New Gaming Headphones Feature Spatial Audio and Multi-Platform Support appeared first on Phandroid.
author: Mike Viray

text: Skullcandy’s wide range of audio gear knows no bounds, and the brand recently expanded its lineup with the new Crusher PLYR 720, a pair of headphones designed for gaming. Priced at $259.99, the headphones feature Skullcandy’s patented Crusher Multi-Sensory Bass, in addition to several other features. Samsung Galaxy S25 Edge Review (SAVE $400!) Skullcandy has gone all-out with the sound features on the 720, which also comes with THX Spatial Audio support and head-tracking technology. With the Skullcandy app, users can further tweak the spatial audio settings, as well as additional customizability options for the built-in RGB lighting on the headphones. For connectivity, there’s Bluetooth 5.3 LE onboard so users can simultaneously listen to game audio and content from another source, each with independent volume control. The Crusher PLYR 720 also comes with “Game-Ready Communications” with Clear Voice Smart Mic technology, Sidetone, and Chatmix Control for communication duties. For connectivity, the headphones will work with various platforms including PC, Xbox, PlayStation, Switch, and even mobile devices. You’re also getting up to 48 hours of battery life, which should be ideal for lengthy online matches.
